intro: Stenocalyx dysentericus, commonly known as the African blueberry, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant produces small, round berries that are edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
